definition: abbr. for 朝鮮|朝鲜[Chao2 xian3] Korea
imperial or royal court/government/dynasty/reign of a sovereign or emperor/court or assembly held by a sovereign or emperor/to make a pilgrimage to/facing/towards
front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly

sentences.english: But I am less interested in looking backward than I am in looking forwards.
sentences.chinese: 但是我对回头看没有兴趣，我要朝前看。

sentences.english: Go straight ahead till you pass a supermarket, the bank is on your left side.
sentences.chinese: 你朝前走，经过一个超市，银行就在你的左边。

sentences.english: We've all moved on. It's called travelling.
sentences.chinese: 我们都在朝前走，这就被称之为“旅行”。

sentences.english: No perpendicular fall is necessary, in front any more than in the rear.
sentences.chinese: 无论朝前和朝后，陡直的下坠总是不必要的。

sentences.english: Dropping the wrist shows the palm of the hand forwards - into the water flow towards you.
sentences.chinese: 沉腕使得手掌朝前，对着朝你而来的水流。

sentences.english: Bodi said goodbye to the little hermit crabs, swim forward again.
sentences.chinese: 波迪告别了小寄居蟹，又朝前游去。

sentences.english: Go straight ahead until you come to a wide street, then turn left.
sentences.chinese: 一直朝前走，到一条宽街时，然后向左转弯。

sentences.english: Cross this street and go ahead for 2 blocks on your right.
sentences.chinese: 穿过这条街往右边朝前走两个街区。

sentences.english: The line of cars moved ahead slowly.
Look forward, open new doors and experience new things.
sentences.chinese: 朝前看，打开一扇新门来体验新事物。

sentences.english: You have to look forward, because life will not go back.
sentences.chinese: 你得朝前看，因为生命不会走回头路。

sentences.english: When they followed her, she would walk on proudly .
sentences.chinese: 他们跟着她追时，她会骄傲地继续朝前走。

sentences.english: The boy ran ahead to rise the sparrows.
sentences.chinese: 小男孩朝前奔去把麻雀轰跑了。

sentences.english: Walk straight ahead until you reach the river.
Off went the boat, with the rat close behind it.
sentences.chinese: 船继续朝前急驶，老鼠跟随在后面。

sentences.english: Go straight ahead, also can't walk far.
sentences.chinese: 一直朝前走，也走不了多远。

definition: stride/to step (on the spot)/to mark time/at a standstill
with all one's might/with sudden force/violently/to slam
to recoil/to draw back/to fall back/to retreat
abbr. for 朝鮮|朝鲜[Chao2 xian3] Korea
imperial or royal court/government/dynasty/reign of a sovereign or emperor/court or assembly held by a sovereign or emperor/to make a pilgrimage to/facing/towards
to turn/to turn around/to transfer (funds etc)
